 Explanation: 
 The digits are removed one by one from the beginning and the end in order alternately 
 so as to obtain the subsequent terms of the series.

Answer : Option C \n Each term in the series is obtained by adding 1 to the square of the preceding term.\n So, missing term = (101)2 + 1 = 10202.
4)In the series 2, 6, 18, 54, ...... what will be the 8th term ?
View Answer

Answer : Option B 
 Clearly, 2 x 3 = 6, 6 x 3 = 18, 18 x 3 = 54,..... 
 So, the series is a G.P. in which a = 2, r = 3. 
 Therefore 8th term = ar8-1 = ar7 = 2 x 37 = (2 x 2187) = 4374.

Answer : Option C \n The sum of any three consecutive terms of the series gives the next term.\n So, missing number = 8 + 15 + 27 = 50.
11)Choose the correct alternative that will continue the same pattern and replace the question mark in the given series. \n 1, 1, 2, 6, 24, ?, 720

Answer : Option D \n The pattern is x 1, x 2, x 3, x 4,..... \n So, missing term = 24 x 5 = 120.
12)Choose the correct alternative that will continue the same pattern and replace the question mark in the given series. \n 2, 15, 4, 12, 6, 7, ?, ?
View Answer

Answer : Option B 
 Let the missing terms of the series be x1 and x2. 
 Thus, the sequence 2, 15, 4, 12, 6, 7, x1 x2 is a combination of two series :
 I. 2, 4, 6, x1 and II. 15, 12, 7, x2I consists of consecutive even numbers. 
 o, missing term, x1 = 8. 
 The pattern in II is - 3, - 5,......So, missing term, x2 = 7 - 7 = 0.

Answer : Option B 
 Each term in the series is obtained by subtracting from the preceding term the number 
 formed by the first three digits of the preceding term. 
 So, missing term = 5242 - 524 = 4718.

Answer : Option C \n Each term in the series, except the first two terms, is the product of the preceding two terms. \n So, missing term = 16 x 128 = 2048.

Answer : Option A \n Each term at an even place in the series is the product of its two adjacent terms. \n Thus, if the missing term be x, then we have : 7 x x = 56 or x = 56 ÷ 7 = 8.

Answer : Option A 
 The given series consists of squares of consecutive prime numbers 
 i.e. 2^2, 3^2, 5^2,....., 
 11^2, 13^2, 17^2, 19^2. 
 So, missing term = 7^2 = 49.
